page.title: 01Loch Dee
page.content: Along the Northern edge of this block runs the only access route. A land rover track, from Loch Trool in the W. to Clatteringshaws Loch in the E. The area comprises mainly 2 large hills: The White Hill with its summit Curley Wee in the West and the Black Laggan ward in the East. In between run the White and Black Laggan burns, which join each other just north of the White Laggan Bothie after which the burn flows into Loch Dee. The Bothie is a little shelter-house, open to anyone who will respect the rules of the house - keep it clean. The house looks out over the loch. The area is mainly moor, ferns, heather & bracken, but on the Eastern slopes the Forestry Commission has recently planted young fir trees. The only other building is the Black Laggan ruin, a former shepherd's hut now deserted.
